title: How to Make a Poll and Use the Voting Buttons in Outlook

steps.title: Open Outlook.
steps.content: Open Outlook. Click the Start menu, click All Apps , select Microsoft Office , and then click Microsoft Outlook .

steps.title: Click New Email.
steps.content: Click New Email . It’s at the top-left corner of Outlook. You can also add a button to message you’re forwarding. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To forward a message, click the message, then click Forward . [2] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the Options menu.
steps.content: Click the Options menu. It’s at the top of the window, toward the left.

steps.title: Click Use Voting Buttons.
steps.content: Click Use Voting Buttons . A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Select a voting button style.
steps.content: Select a voting button style. Once you make your selection, a message will appear that says “You Have Added Voting Buttons to This Message.” Here’s what the different options do: [3] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source Approve;Reject: Use when you need authorization for something. Yes;No: This is a great way to do a fast poll. Yes;No;Maybe: Adds an additional response to the Yes and No poll. Custom: Gives you the option to customize your own poll options, such as time and date options. If you choose this option, check the box beside “Use voting buttons” under “Voting and Tracking options,” create your button text, then click Close .

steps.title: Enter your desired recipients.
steps.content: Enter your desired recipients. Type the email address(s) into the To: and CC: fields as needed.

steps.title: Add a subject and message.
steps.content: Add a subject and message. Use the message and/or subject boxes to describe the details of the poll.

steps.title: Click Send.
steps.content: Click Send . It’s at the top-left corner of the message. When the message is delivered to the recipients, they can click Click here to vote to access the buttons, and then cast their votes. Responses will be delivered to your inbox. You can view all responses in a table. To do so, open one of the response messages, click The sender responded in the message header, and then click View voting responses . [4] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Open Outlook.
steps.content: Open Outlook. Click the Start menu, click All Apps , select Microsoft Office , and then click Microsoft Outlook .

steps.title: Double-click the message that contains the poll.
steps.content: Double-click the message that contains the poll. This opens the message in its own window. If you’re viewing the message in the reading pane, click Click here to vote in the message’s header, and then skip to the last step.

steps.title: Click the Message tab.
steps.content: Click the Message tab. It’s at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click Vote.
steps.content: Click Vote . It’s under the “Respond” header. [5] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the option you want.
steps.content: Click the option you want. This will add your vote to the results of the poll.

steps.title: Open Outlook.
steps.content: Open Outlook. Click the Start menu, click All Apps , select Microsoft Office , and then click Microsoft Outlook . Use this method after you’ve created a poll and want to view the results.

steps.title: Click the Sent Items folder.
steps.content: Click the Sent Items folder. It’s in the left panel. [6] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the message that contains the poll.
steps.content: Click the message that contains the poll. This opens the message in the reading pane. [7] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click the Message tab.
steps.content: Click the Message tab. It’s at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click Tracking.
steps.content: Click Tracking . It’s under the “Show” header. The results of the poll now appear in a table inside the window. [8] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source You won’t see the Tracking button until at least one of the recipients casts a vote.
